Organic light emitting display device and method of driving the same

description.p: The present invention relates to an organic light emitting display device and a method of driving the same.

Recently, various flat panel display devices having reduced weight and volume over cathode ray tubes have been developed. Among flat panel display devices, there are liquid crystal display (LCD) devices, field emission display (FED) devices, plasma display panels (PDPs), organic light emitting display (OLED) devices, etc.

Among other displays, organic light emitting display devices have various advantages including excellent color reproducibility, slimness, and the like, and have application in wide fields such as personal digital assistants (PDAs) and MP3 players, as well as cellular phones.
The organic light emitting display devices display images using organic light emitting diodes (OLED) that determine a brightness of light corresponding to an amount of current to be input.

The flat panel display devices as described above have a problem in that motion blur may occur. Korean Patent Publication No. 2007-0068181 discloses an entire screen being displayed in black between frames in order to address the motion blur. US patent application 2004189583 describes an impulsive type liquid crystal driving device which inserts black data during a vertical blanking interval and then realizes motion picture, international Patent application WO2004006008 and US patent application 2007132709 relate to a liquid crystal displays and driving methods thereof. Japanese patent application 2003140619 intends to provide a scanning line driving device capable of improving visibility of a moving picture.

Based on the above reason, in order to prevent the motion blur, the organic light emitting display device allows the entire screen to be displayed in black by blocking the driving current flowing into the organic light emitting diode.

However, recently display devices started changing frames at 30 frames per second (fps) at a high resolution. Therefore, more scan signals are sequentially generated in a high resolution screen than in a low resolution screen during a short time during which one frame is maintained, so that a time when a data signal is transmitted to a pixel to be maintained is very short. The aspect of a very short time when a data signal is transmitted to a pixel to be maintained means that a time when the black image inserted for blocking the motion blur is maintained is correspondingly also short.

At this time, if the time that the black image is displayed is very short, the time that the current is blocked in the organic light emitting diode is short, causing a problem that the motion blur is not effectively prevented.

Therefore, it is an aspect of an exemplary embodiment of the present invention to provide an organic light emitting display device that shortens a time when a black image is input for reducing or preventing a motion blur phenomenon, and a method of driving the same.

According to a first aspect of the present invention an organic light emitting display device includes a display region, a data driver, a scan driver, and a controller. The display region displays frames of images according to data signals and scan signals. The data driver transmits data for displaying first frames of the frames and transmits data for displaying second frames of the frames, each of the second frames for displaying black on an entirety of the display region between the first frames. The scan driver includes first and second scan driving circuits for transmitting the scan signals on a plurality of scan lines, and a switch unit for selectively coupling the first and second scan driving circuits, the scan driver yet further comprising a start pulse input for receiving a start pulse and the first scan driving circuit having 1 to k first output terminals, each connected to one of 1 to k adjacent scan lines, wherein k is a positive natural number lower than n, and the second scan driving circuit having (n - k) second output terminals, each connected to one of (k+1) to n adjacent scan lines. The scan driver is configured to transmit the scan signals to the scan lines sequentially during the first frames and to transmit respective scan signals to at least two of the scan lines concurrently by driving the first and second scan driving circuits in parallel during the second frames. The controller outputs a driving control signal to control the switch unit.

The first scan driving circuit comprises a first input terminal directly connected to the start pulse input of the scan driver and adapted to receive the start pulse and to sequentially output, responsive to the start pulse, a plurality of scan first output terminals signals to 1 to k first output terminals.

The second scan driving circuit comprises a second input terminal that receives the start pulse or the scan signal transmitted from the k-th output terminal of the first output terminals, and (n-k) second output terminals that output a plurality of scan signals to (k+1) to n adjacent scan lines corresponding to the start pulse or the scan signal output from the last output terminal.

The switch unit may include a first transistor for selectively coupling the last output terminal of the first output terminals of the first scan driving circuit to the second input terminal of the second scan driving circuit responsive to the control signal; and a second transistor for selectively transmitting the start pulse to the second input terminal of the second scan driving circuit responsive to the control signal.

The first transistor and the second transistor may have different channel types. For example, the first transistor may be a p-channel transistor and the second transistor may be an n-channel transistor.

According to a second aspect of the present invention, a method of driving an organic light emitting display device includes a data driver and a scan driver having a plurality of scan driving circuits. Data for displaying images in first frames is transmitted, the data including image data and in second frames including black data, the first frames alternating with the second frames. The plurality of scan driving circuits of the scan driver are operated in sequence during the first frames, and the plurality of scan driving circuits of the scan driver are operated in parallel during the second frames.

When operating the plurality of scan driving circuits of the scan driver in parallel, the scan driver may transmit a start pulse to the plurality of scan driving circuits in parallel responsive to a control signal, and may block a coupling between at least two of the plurality of scan driving circuits responsive to the control signal.

When operating the plurality of scan driving circuits of the scan driver in series, the driving circuits responsive to the control signal, and may electrically couple together the at least two of the plurality of scan driving circuits.
The start pulse or a last scan signal of the first driving circuit may be selectively transmitted to a second scan driving circuit of the plurality of scan driving circuits.

With the organic light emitting display device and the method of driving the same according to exemplary embodiments of the present invention, the time during which the black image is maintained can be increased by reducing the time required to insert the black image, making it possible to reduce or prevent a motion blur phenomenon from occurring on the flat panel display device that displays a large and high precision image.

The accompanying drawings, together with the specification, illustrate exemplary embodiments of the present invention, and, together with the description, serve to explain the principles of the present invention.

Here, when a first element is described as being coupled to a second element, the first element may be directly coupled to the second element or may be indirectly coupled to the second element via a third element. Further, some of the elements that are not essential to the complete understanding of the invention are omitted for clarity. Also, like reference numerals refer to like elements throughout.
Hereinafter, exemplary embodiments of the present invention will be described with reference to the accompanying drawings.

FIG. 1 is a structure view of an organic light emitting display device according to an exemplary embodiment of the present invention. Referring to FIG. 1, the organic light emitting display device includes a display region 100, a data driver 200, a scan driver 300 and a controller 400.

The display region 100 includes a plurality of pixels 101, wherein each of the pixels 101 includes an organic light emitting diode (OLED, not shown) that emits light corresponding to a current flow through the OLED. On the display region 100, n scan lines S1, S2, ... Sn-1, and Sn extend in a row direction for transmitting scan signals, and m data lines D1, D2, ... Dm-1, and Dm extend in a column direction for transmitting data signals.

Also, the display region 100 is driven by receiving first power ELVDD and second power ELVSS. Therefore, the display region 100 emits light to display images by allowing current to flow on the organic light emitting diodes in accordance with the scan signals, the data signals, the first power ELVDD, and the second power ELVSS.

The data driver 200 generates data signals corresponding to image signals (RGB data) input through the controller 400 and further, corresponding to black image signals. At this time, one frame is generated utilizing the data signals, wherein first frames are implemented through the data signals utilizing the image signals RGB data having red, green and blue components and second frames are implemented through the data signals utilizing the black image signals. The data driver 200 transmits the data signals to the display region 100 to enable the image formed in a plurality of frames including the first frames and the second frames to be displayed on the display region 100. At this time, the images displayed on the display region 100 include the second frames periodically inserted between the plurality of first frames, thereby enabling some frames of the images to be displayed in black. The motion blur is reduced by the second frames as described above.

The scan driver 300, which is a device that generates scan signals, is coupled to scan lines S1, S2, .... Sn-1, and Sn to transmit scan signals to a specific row of the pixels 101. The data signals output from the data driver 200 are transmitted to the pixels 101 concurrently with the transmission of the scan signals so that a voltage corresponding to the data signals is transmitted to the pixels 101. Also, the scan driver 300 includes a plurality of scan driving circuits 310 and 320 for generating scan signals. According to exemplary embodiments of the invention the plurality of scan driving circuits 310 and 320 is driven by two methods.

The first method relates to the driving of the scan driver 300 when the first frames are driven. After receiving a start pulse, the first scan driving circuit 310 generates scan signals in series to allow a last scan signal to function as the start pulse of the second scan driving circuit 320.

The second method relates to the driving of the scan driver 300 when the second frames are driven. The scan driving circuits 310 and 320 included in the scan driver 300 operate by concurrently receiving respective start pulses. If the scan driving circuits 310 and 320 included in the scan driver 300 concurrently receive the respective start pulses, the scan driving circuits 310 and 320 output scan signals in parallel. Therefore, data signals are transmitted concurrently to two rows of the pixels 101 so that a time required to form the second frames in accordance with the data signals becomes short. As a result, the time that the second frames maintain the black image becomes long.

While the first frames are driven in accordance with the data signals output from the data driver 200, the switch unit 330 transmits the start pulse only to the first scan driving circuit 310 of the scan driver 300 and allows the respective scan driving circuits 310 and 320 to be electrically coupled to each other. The electrical coupling between the scan driving circuits 310 and 320 will be described in more detail below. While the second frames are driven in accordance with the data signals output from the data driver 200, the switch unit 330 transmits the start pulses to each of the plurality of scan driving circuits 310 and 320 and blocks the coupling between the plurality of scan driving circuits 310 and 320.

The controller 400 outputs data driving control signals DCS, scan driving control signals SCS and the data signals RGB data. Further, the controller 400 controls the operation of the switch unit 330 and allows the driving method of the scan signals output from the scan driver 300 to be different when driving the first frame and driving the second frame.

FIG. 2 is a timing diagram showing signals transmitted to an organic light emitting display device according to an exemplary embodiment of the present invention. Referring to FIG. 2, in a displayed image, a data signal corresponding to one frame is transmitted at a time starting when a vertical synchronization signal Vsync is transmitted, and a data signal corresponding to a next frame is transmitted at a time starting when a next vertical synchronization signal Vsync is transmitted. A time when image signal RGB data corresponding to one horizontal line of the display region 100 is transmitted, and then a time when image signal RGB data corresponding to a next horizontal line thereof is transmitted is determined by a horizontal synchronization signal Hsync.

At this time, the vertical synchronization signal Vsync and the horizontal synchronization signal Hsync are transmitted during a period (e.g., a predetermined period) so that the time that one frame is driven is constant.

A time when a first scan signal is output from the scan driver 300 is determined by a start pulse SP corresponding to the vertical synchronization signal Vsync. In other words, when the start pulse SP is input to the scan driver 300, the scan driver 300 generates scan signals to be driven on the scan lines S1-Sn.

A driving control signal CS that controls the operation of the scan driver 300 is input corresponding to the first frames and the second frames. The driving control signal CS is included in the scan driving control signal SCS output from the controller 400. The operation of the scan driver 300 corresponding to each of the first frame and the second frame is determined by the driving control signal CS.

During the first frame, the scan signals are transmitted sequentially from the first scan line S1 to the last scan line Sn of the display region 100. Therefore, the data signals are applied to the pixels coupled to the scan lines S1-Sn according to the order that the scan signals are transmitted.

However, during the second frame, a plurality of the scan lines of the display region 100 are concurrently selected, so that the scan signals are concurrently transmitted from the plurality of scan lines. In other words, according to one embodiment a first scan signal Sk+1 is output from the second scan driving circuit 320 concurrently with a time when a first scan signal S1 is output from the first scan driving circuit 310. Therefore, the data signals are concurrently transmitted to the pixels coupled to the respective scan lines S1 and Sk+1.

Based on the reasons described above, during the second frame, in an embodiment having two scan driving circuits in the scan driver 300, the data signals are concurrently transmitted to two horizontal lines, and in an embodiment having four scan driving circuits, the data signals are concurrently transmitted to four horizontal lines. Therefore, the speed with which the data signals are transmitted to the entirety of the display region 100 in the second frame is at least twice as high as that in the first frame.

Because the vertical synchronization signal Vsync is input during a period of time (e.g., a predetermined period) as described above, if the time required to input the black image is fast as above, the time that the black image is maintained for each pixel becomes long. If the time that the black image is maintained in the pixel becomes long, the time that current does not flow on the organic light emitting diode becomes longer, making it possible to show the improvement resulting from the insertion of the frame constituted by the black image.

FIG. 3 is a structure view showing a coupling relationship between the plurality of scan driving circuits 310 and 320 and the switch unit 330 of FIG. 1. Referring to FIG. 3, the scan driver 300 includes a first scan driving circuit 310, a second scan driving circuit 320, and a switch unit 330 that includes first and second transistors M1 and M2. The switch unit 330 is positioned between the first and second scan driving circuits 310 and 320.
The first scan driving circuit 310 generates a plurality of scan signals corresponding to a timing of a start pulse SP.
The second scan driving circuit 320 receives the start pulse SP or a scan signal of the scan signals generated by the first scan driving circuit 310 to start to be driven.

In the illustrated embodiment, the first transistor M1 is a p-channel device. The source of the first transistor M1 of the switch unit 330 is coupled to the last output terminal Sk of the first scan driving circuit 310, and the drain thereof is coupled to an input terminal of the second scan driving circuit 320. The gate of the first transistor M1 is coupled to a control terminal to which the scan control signal CS is input.

In the illustrated embodiment, the second transistor M2 is an n-channel device. The source of the second transistor M2 of the switch unit 330 is coupled to a terminal to which the start pulse SP is input, and the drain thereof is coupled to the input terminal of the scan driving circuit 320. The gate of the second transistor M2 is coupled to the control terminal to which the scan control signal CS is input.
The scan driver 300 constituted as above is driven in a different way when driving the first frame from when driving the second frame.

First, when driving the first frame, as illustrated in FIG. 2, the control signal CS is high. Thus, the first transistor M1 is in a turned-on state, and the second transistor M2 is in a turned-off state. At this time, the first scan driving circuit 310 receives the start pulse SP and generates the plurality of scan signals in series. Because the first transistor M1 is in the turned-on state, the last scan signal of the scan signals generated from the first scan driving circuit 310 conducts through the first transistor M1 and is transmitted to the second scan driving circuit 320. Because the second transistor M2 is in the turned-off state, the start pulse SP input to the first scan driving circuit 310 is blocked from being input to the second scan driving circuit 320. Thus, the last scan signal generated by the first scan driving circuit 310 functions as the start pulse of the second scan driving circuit 320.

When driving the second frame, as illustrated in FIG. 2, the control signal CS is low, and thus the first transistor M1 of the switch unit 330 is in the turned-off state and the second transistor M2 is in the turned-on state. Therefore, the start pulse SP is transmitted through the second transistor M2 and is thus concurrently transmitted to the first scan driving circuit 310 and the second scan driving circuit 320. However, because the first transistor M1 is in the turned-off state, the coupling between the first scan driving circuit 310 and the second scan driving circuit 320 is blocked. Therefore, the first scan driving circuit 310 and the second scan driving circuit 320 are driven in parallel to output the plurality of scan signals, respectively.

claim.claim-text: Organische lichtemittierende Anzeige, umfassend: einen Anzeigebereich (100), der ausgeführt ist, Frames von Bildern gemäß Datensignalen und Abtastsignalen anzuzeigen, wobei der Anzeigebereich (100) m Datenleitungen (D1, ..., Dm) und n Abtastleitungen (S1, ..., Sn) umfasst, wobei m und n natürliche Zahlen sind und wobei n größer als 1 ist; einen Datentreiber (200), der mit den m Datenleitungen (D1, ..., Dm) verbunden ist und ausgeführt ist, die Datensignale zu erzeugen, die Bildsignalen entsprechen, die erste Frames darstellen, und Datensignale zu erzeugen, die Bildsignalen für Schwarz entsprechen, die zweite Frames darstellen, wobei der Datentreiber (200) ferner ausgeführt ist, die zweiten Frames zwischen den ersten Frames bereitzustellen und dadurch Schwarz auf einer Gesamtheit des Anzeigebereichs (100) zwischen den ersten Frames anzuzeigen; einen Abtasttreiber (300), der konfiguriert ist, die Abtastsignale an die Abtastleitungen (S1, S2, ..., Sn) zu übertragen und erste (310) und zweite (320) Abtasttreiberschaltungen zur Übertragung der Abtastsignale auf den Abtastleitungen (S1, S2, ..., Sn) umfasst, wobei die erste Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) 1 bis k erste Ausgangsanschlüsse aufweist, die jeweils mit einer von 1 bis k angrenzenden Abtastleitungen (S1, ..., Sn) verbunden sind, wobei k eine positive natürliche Zahl niedriger als n ist, und die zweite Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) (n - k) zweite Ausgangsanschlüsse aufweist, die jeweils mit einer der (k+1) bis n angrenzenden Abtastleitungen (S1, ..., Sn) verbunden sind, wobei der Abtasttreiber (300) ferner eine Schalteinheit (330) umfasst, die zwischen die ersten (310) und die zweiten (320) Abtasttreiberschaltungen geschaltet ist, wobei der Abtasttreiber (300) ferner einen Startimpulseingang zum Empfangen eines Startimpulses (SP) umfasst; und eine Steuerung (400), die ausgeführt ist, extern bereitgestellte Bildsignale zu empfangen und die Bildsignale an den Datentreiber (200) zu übertragen und zur Steuerung der Schalteinheit (330) ein Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS) an die Schalteinheit (330) sowie zur Steuerung des Datentreibers (200) ein Datentreibersteuersignal (DCS) an den Datentreiber (200) auszugeben, wobei die erste Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) einen ersten Eingangsanschluss umfasst, der direkt mit dem Startimpulseingang des Abtasttreibers (300) verbunden ist, und ausgeführt ist, den Startimpuls (SP) zu empfangen und sequentiell, als Reaktion auf den Startimpuls (SP), eine Vielzahl von Abtastsignalen an 1 bis k erste Ausgangsanschlüsse auszugeben, wobei die zweite Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) einen zweiten Eingangsanschluss umfasst, der mit der Schalteinheit (330) verbunden ist, und ausgeführt ist, ein Ausgangssignal von der Schalteinheit (330) zu empfangen und sequentiell eine Vielzahl von Abtastsignalen entsprechend dem Ausgangssignal von der Schalteinheit (330) auszugeben, und wobei die Schalteinheit (330) einen ersten Eingang aufweist, der mit dem Startimpulseingang des Abtasttreibers (300) verbunden ist, und einen zweiten Eingang, der mit dem k'ten Ausgangsanschluss der ersten Ausgangsanschlüsse verbunden ist, und ausgeführt ist, den k'ten Ausgangsanschluss der ersten Ausgangsanschlüsse mit dem zweiten Eingangsanschluss während der ersten Frames oder den Startimpulseingang mit dem zweiten Eingangsanschluss während der zweiten Frames als Reaktion auf das Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS) wahlweise zu verbinden.

Organische lichtemittierende Anzeige nach Anspruch 1, wobei die Schalteinheit (330) umfasst: einen ersten Transistor (M1) zum wahlweisen Koppeln des letzten Ausgangsanschlusses der ersten Ausgangsanschlüsse der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) mit dem zweiten Eingangsanschluss der zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) als Reaktion auf das Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS); und einen zweiten Transistor (M2) zum wahlweisen Übertragen des Startimpulses (SP) an den zweiten Eingangsanschluss der zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) als Reaktion auf das Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS).
Organische lichtemittierende Anzeige nach Anspruch 2, wobei der erste Transistor (M1) und der zweite Transistor (M2) unterschiedliche Kanaltypen aufweisen.
Organische lichtemittierende Anzeige nach Anspruch 3, wobei der erste Transistor (M1) ein p-Kanal-Transistor ist und der zweite Transistor (M2) ein n-Kanal-Transistor ist.

Verfahren zum Ansteuern einer organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach einem der vorstehenden Ansprüche, wobei das Verfahren umfasst: Übertragen von Daten zum Anzeigen von Bildern in ersten Frames umfassend Bilddaten und in zweiten Frames umfassend Schwarzdaten, wobei sich die ersten Frames mit den zweiten Frames abwechseln; Abtasten sämtlicher n Abtastleitungen nacheinander während der ersten Frames; und sequentielles Abtasten der k angrenzenden ersten der n Abtastleitungen und sequentielles Abtasten der (n - k) angrenzenden zweiten der n Abtastleitungen während der zweiten Frames, wobei das sequentielle Abtasten der k angrenzenden ersten der n Abtastleitungen und das seqeuentielles Abtasten der (n - k) angrenzenden zweiten der n Abtastleitungen gleichzeitig durchgeführt wird.

Verfahren zum Ansteuern der organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach Anspruch 5, wobei das sequentielle Abtasten der k angrenzenden ersten der n Abtastleitungen und das seqeuentielle Abtasten der (n - k) angrenzenden zweiten der n Abtastleitungen während der zweiten Frames das parallele Übertragen eines Startimpulses (SP) an die ersten und zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltungen (310, 320) als Reaktion auf das Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS) sowie das Blockieren eines Koppelns zwischen ersten und zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltungen (310, 320) als Reaktion auf das Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS) umfasst.

Verfahren zum Ansteuern der organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach Anspruch 6, wobei das sequentielle Abtasten sämtlicher n Abtastleitungen während der ersten Frames das Übertragen des Startimpulses (SP) an die erste Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) als Reaktion auf das Abtasttreibersteuersignal (SCS) und das elektrische Zusammenkoppeln der ersten und zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltungen (310, 320) umfasst.

Verfahren zum Ansteuern der organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach einem der Ansprüche 5 bis 7, ferner umfassend das wahlweise Übertragen des Startimpulses (SP) oder eines letzten Abtastsignals der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) an die zweite Abtasttreiberschaltung (320).

Verfahren zum Ansteuern der organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach einem der Ansprüche 5 bis 8, ferner umfassend das Übertragen von Abtastsignalen an die Abtastleitungen (S1, S2, ..., Sn) nacheinander als Reaktion auf einen an den jeweiligen Eingangsanschluss übertragenen Impuls.

Verfahren zum Ansteuern der organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach Anspruch 8 und 9, wobei das wahlweise Übertragen des Startimpulses (SP) oder des letzten Abtastsignals der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) das Steuern eines elektrischen Koppelns einer letzten Abtastleitung (Sk) der mit der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) gekoppelten k angrenzenden ersten der Abtastleitungen (S1, S2, ..., Sk) mit dem Eingangsanschluss der zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) und das Steuern eines elektrischen Koppelns des Eingangsanschlusses der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) mit dem Eingangsanschluss der zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) umfasst.

Verfahren zum Ansteuern der organischen lichtemittierenden Anzeige nach Anspruch 10, wobei das elektrische Koppeln der mit der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) gekoppelten letzten Abtastleitung (Sk) der k angrenzenden ersten der Abtastleitungen (S1, S2, ..., Sk) mit dem Eingangsanschluss der zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) und das elektrische Koppeln des Eingangsanschlusses der ersten Abtasttreiberschaltung (310) mit dem Eingangsanschluss der zweiten Abtasttreiberschaltung (320) sich gegenseitig ausschließen.

An organic light emitting display comprising: a display region (100) adapted to display frames of images according to data signals and scan signals, the display region (100) comprising m data lines (D1,..., Dm) and n scan lines (S1,..., Sn), wherein m and n are natural numbers and wherein n is greater than 1; a data driver (200) connected to the m data lines (D1,...,Dm) and adapted to generate the data signals corresponding to image signals representing first frames and to generate data signals corresponding to black image signals representing second frames, the data driver (200) further being adapted to provide the second frames between the first frames and to thereby display black on an entirety of the display region (100) between the first frames; a scan driver (300) configured to transmit the scan signals to the scan lines (S1, S2, ..., Sn) and comprising first (310) and second (320) scan driving circuits for transmitting the scan signals on the scan lines (S1, S2, ..., Sn), the first scan driving circuit (310) having 1 to k first output terminals, each connected to one of 1 to k adjacent scan lines (S1,..., Sn), wherein k is a positive natural number lower than n, and the second scan driving circuit (320) having (n - k) second output terminals, each connected to one of (k+1) to n adjacent scan lines (S1,..., Sn), the scan driver (300) further comprising a switch unit (330) connected between the first (310) and second (320) scan driving circuits, the scan driver (300) further comprising a start pulse input for receiving a start pulse (SP); and a controller (400) adapted to receive externally provided image signals and to transmit the image signals to the data driver (200) and to output a scan driving control signal (SCS) to the switch unit (330) to control the switch unit (330) and a data driving control signal (DCS) to the data driver (200) to control the data driver (200), wherein the first scan driving circuit (310) comprises a first input terminal directly connected to the start pulse input of the scan driver (300) and is adapted to receive the start pulse (SP) and to sequentially output, responsive to the start pulse (SP), a plurality of scan signals to 1 to k first output terminals, wherein the second scan driving circuit (320) comprises a second input terminal connected to the switch unit (330) and is adapted to receive an output signal from the switch unit (330) and to sequentially output a plurality of scan signals corresponding to the output signal from the switch unit (330), and wherein the switch unit (330) has a first input connected to the start pulse input of the scan driver (300) and a second input connected the k-th output terminal of the first output terminals and is adapted to selectively connect the k-th output terminal of the first output terminals to the second input terminal during the first frames or the start pulse input to the second input terminal during the second frames in response to the scan driving control signal (SCS).

The organic light emitting display as claimed in claim 1, wherein the switch unit (330) comprises: a first transistor (M1) for selectively coupling the last output terminal of the first output terminals of the first scan driving circuit (310) to the second input terminal of the second scan driving circuit (320) responsive to the scan driving control signal (SCS); and a second transistor (M2) for selectively transmitting the start pulse (SP) to the second input terminal of the second scan driving circuit (320) responsive to the scan driving control signal (SCS).
The organic light emitting display as claimed in claim 2, wherein the first transistor (M1) and the second transistor (M2) have different channel types.
The organic light emitting display as claimed in claim 3, wherein the first transistor (M1) is a p-channel transistor and the second transistor (M2) is an n-channel transistor.

A method of driving an organic light emitting display according to one of the preceding claims, the method comprising: transmitting data for displaying images in first frames comprising image data and in second frames comprising black data, the first frames alternating with the second frames; scanning all n scan lines in sequence during the first frames; and sequentially scanning the k adjacent first ones of the n scan lines and sequentially scanning the (n - k) adjacent second ones of the n scan lines during the second frames, wherein sequentially scanning the k adjacent first ones of the n scan lines and sequentially scanning the (n - k) adjacent second ones of the n scan lines is carried out concurrently.

The method of driving the organic light emitting display as claimed in claim 5, wherein sequentially scanning the k adjacent first ones of the n scan lines and sequentially scanning the (n - k) adjacent second ones of the n scan lines during the second frames comprises transmitting a start pulse (SP) to the first and second scan driving circuits (310, 320) in parallel responsive to the scan driving control signal (SCS), and blocking a coupling between first and second scan driving circuits (310, 320) responsive to the scan driving control signal (SCS).

The method of driving the organic light emitting display as claimed in claim 6, wherein sequentially scanning all n scan lines during the first frames comprises transmitting the start pulse (SP) to first scan driving circuit (310) responsive to the scan driving control signal (SCS), and electrically coupling together the first and second scan driving circuits (310, 320).

The method of driving the organic light emitting display as claimed in any one of claims 5 through 7, further comprising selectively transmitting the start pulse (SP) or a last scan signal of the first scan driving circuit (310) to the second scan driving circuit (320).

The method of driving the organic light emitting display as claimed in any one of claims 5 through 8, further comprising transmitting scan signals to the scan lines (S1, S2, ..., Sn) in sequence responsive to a pulse transmitted to the respective input terminal.

The method of driving the organic light emitting display as claimed in claims 8 and 9, wherein selectively transmitting the start pulse (SP) or the last scan signal of the first scan driving circuit (310) comprises controlling an electrical coupling of a last scan line (Sk) of the k adjacent first ones of the scan lines (S1, S2, ..., Sk) coupled to the first scan driving circuit (310) with the input terminal of the second scan driving circuit (320), and controlling an electrical coupling of the input terminal of the first scan driving circuit (310) with the input terminal of the second scan driving circuit (320).

The method of driving the organic light emitting display as claimed in claim 10, wherein the electrical coupling of the last scan line (Sk) of the k adjacent first ones of the scan lines (S1, S2, ..., Sk) coupled to the first scan driving circuit (310) with the input terminal of the second scan driving circuit (320) and the electrical coupling of the input terminal of the first scan driving circuit (310) with the input terminal of the second scan driving circuit (320) are mutually exclusive.

Afficheur électroluminescent organique comprenant : une région d'affichage (100) apte à afficher des trames d'images en fonction de signaux de données et de signaux de balayage, la région d'affichage (100) comprenant m lignes de données (D1, ..., Dm) et n lignes de balayage (S1, ..., Sn), où m et n sont des entiers naturels et où n est supérieur à 1 ; un circuit d'attaque de données (200) connecté aux m lignes de données (D1, ..., Dm) et apte à générer les signaux de données correspondant à des signaux d'image représentant des premières trames et à générer des signaux de données correspondant à des signaux d'image noirs représentant des secondes trames, le circuit d'attaque de données (200) étant en outre apte à fournir des secondes trames entre les premières trames et à afficher ainsi du noir sur la totalité de la région d'affichage (100) entre les premières trames ; un circuit d'attaque de balayage (300) configuré pour transmettre les signaux de balayage aux lignes de balayage (S1, S2, ..., Sn) et comprenant des premier (310) et second (320) circuits d'attaque de balayage destinés à transmettre les signaux de balayage sur les lignes de balayage (S1, S2, ..., Sn), le premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) comportant 1 à k premières bornes de sortie, chacune connectée à l'une de 1 à k lignes de balayage adjacentes (S1, ..., Sn), où k est un entier naturel positif inférieur à n, et le second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320) comportant (n - k) secondes bornes de sortie, chacune connectée à l'une de (k+1) à n lignes de balayage adjacentes (S1, ..., Sn), le circuit d'attaque de balayage (300) comprenant en outre une unité de commutation (330) connectée entre les premier (310) et second (320) circuits d'attaque de balayage, le circuit d'attaque de balayage (300) comprenant en outre une entrée d'impulsion de déclenchement destinée à recevoir une impulsion de déclenchement (SP) ; et une unité de commande (400) apte à recevoir des signaux d'images fournis de l'extérieur et à transmettre les signaux d'image au circuit d'attaque de données (200) et à fournir en sortie un signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS) à l'unité de commutation (330) et à commander l'unité de commutation (330) et un circuit de commande d'attaque de données (DCS) au circuit d'attaque de données (200) pour commander le circuit d'attaque de données (200), dans lequel le premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) comprend une première borne d'entrée directement connectée à l'entrée d'impulsion de déclenchement du circuit d'attaque de balayage (300) et est apte à recevoir l'impulsion de déclenchement (SP) et à fournir séquentiellement en sortie, en réponse à l'impulsion de déclenchement (SP), une pluralité de signaux de balayage à 1 à k premières bornes de sortie, dans lequel le second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320) comprend une seconde borne d'entrée connectée à l'unité de commutation (330) et est apte à recevoir un signal de sortie de l'unité de commutation (330) et à fournir séquentiellement en sortie une pluralité de signaux de balayage correspondant au signal de sortie de l'unité de commutation (330), et dans lequel l'unité de commutation (330) comporte une première entrée connectée à l'entrée d'impulsion de déclenchement du circuit d'attaque de balayage (300) et une seconde entrée connectée à la k-ème borne de sortie des premières bornes de sortie et est apte à connecter sélectivement la k-ème borne de sortie des premières bornes de sortie à la seconde borne d'entrée pendant les premières trames ou l'impulsion de déclenchement fournie en entrée à la seconde borne d'entrée pendant les secondes trames en réponse au signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS).

Afficheur électroluminescent organique selon la revendication 1, dans lequel l'unité de commutation (330) comprend : un premier transistor (M1) destiné à relier sélectivement la dernière borne de sortie des premières bornes de sortie du premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) à la seconde borne d'entrée du second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320) en réponse au signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS) ; et un second transistor (M2) destiné à transmettre sélectivement l'impulsion de déclenchement (SP) à la seconde borne d'entrée du second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320) en réponse au signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS).
Afficheur électroluminescent organique selon la revendication 2, dans lequel le premier transistor (M1) et le second transistor (M2) ont des types de canaux différents.
Afficheur électroluminescent organique selon la revendication 3, dans lequel le premier transistor (M1) est un transistor à canal p et le second transistor (M2) est un transistor à canal n.

Procédé d'attaque d'un afficheur électroluminescent organique selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, le procédé consistant à : transmettre des données pour afficher des images dans des premières trames comprenant des données d'image et des secondes trames comprenant des données noires, les premières trames alternant avec les secondes trames ; balayer en séquence la totalité de n lignes de balayage pendant les premières trames ; et balayer séquentiellement les k premières lignes adjacentes des n lignes de balayage et balayer séquentiellement les (n - k) secondes lignes adjacentes des n lignes de balayage pendant les secondes trames, dans lequel le balayage séquentiel des k premières lignes adjacentes des n lignes de balayage et le balayage séquentiel des (n - k) secondes lignes adjacentes des n lignes de balayage sont effectués simultanément.

Procédé d'attaque de l'afficheur électroluminescent organique selon la revendication 5, dans lequel le balayage séquentiel des k premières lignes adjacentes des n lignes de balayage et le balayage séquentiel des (n - k) secondes lignes adjacentes des n lignes de balayage pendant les secondes trames consiste à transmettre en parallèle une impulsion de déclenchement (SP) aux premier et second circuits d'attaque de balayage (310, 320) en réponse au signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS), et à bloquer une liaison entre les premier et second circuits d'attaque de balayage (310, 320) en réponse au signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS).

Procédé d'attaque de l'afficheur électroluminescent organique selon la revendication 6, dans lequel le balayage séquentiel de la totalité des n lignes de balayage pendant les premières trames consiste à transmettre l'impulsion de déclenchement (SP) au premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) en réponse au signal de commande d'attaque de balayage (SCS), et à relier électriquement l'un à l'autre les premier et second circuits d'attaque de balayage (310, 320).

Procédé d'attaque de l'afficheur électroluminescent organique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 5 à 7, consistant en outre à transmettre sélectivement l'impulsion de déclenchement (SP) ou un dernier signal de balayage du premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) au second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320).

Procédé d'attaque de l'afficheur électroluminescent organique selon l'une quelconque des revendications 5 à 8, consistant en outre à transmettre en séquence des signaux de balayage aux lignes de balayage (S1, S2, ..., Sn) en réponse à une impulsion transmise à la borne d'entrée respective.

Procédé d'attaque de l'afficheur électroluminescent organique selon les revendications 8 et 9, dans lequel la transmission sélective de l'impulsion de déclenchement (SP) ou du dernier signal de balayage du premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) consiste à commander une liaison électrique d'une dernière ligne de balayage (Sk) des k premières lignes adjacentes des lignes de balayage (S1, S2,..., Sk) reliées au premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) à la borne d'entrée du second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320), et à commander une liaison électrique de la première borne d'entrée du premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) à la borne d'entrée du second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320).

Procédé d'attaque de l'afficheur électroluminescent organique selon la revendication 10, dans lequel la liaison électrique de la dernière ligne de balayage (Sk) des k premières lignes adjacentes des lignes de balayage (S1, S2, ..., Sk) reliées au premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) à la borne d'entrée du second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320) et la liaison électrique de la borne d'entrée du premier circuit d'attaque de balayage (310) à la borne d'entrée du second circuit d'attaque de balayage (320) sont mutuellement exclusives.
